filter_blur_hover="0"][fusion_builder_row][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" spacing="" center_content="no" link="" target="_self" min_height="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" hover_type="none" border_size="0" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" border_radius="" box_shadow="no" dimension_box_shadow="" box_shadow_blur="0" box_shadow_spread="0" box_shadow_color="" box_shadow_style="" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="" background_type="single" gradient_start_color="" gradient_end_color="" gradient_start_position="0" gradient_end_position="100" gradient_type="linear" radial_direction="center" linear_angle="180" background_color="" background_image="" background_image_id="" background_position="left top" background_repeat="no-repeat" background_blend_mode="none" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" filter_type="regular" filter_hue="0" filter_saturation="100" filter_brightness="100" filter_contrast="100" filter_invert="0" filter_sepia="0" filter_opacity="100" filter_blur="0" filter_hue_hover="0" filter_saturation_hover="100" filter_brightness_hover="100" filter_contrast_hover="100" filter_invert_hover="0" filter_sepia_hover="0" filter_opacity_hover="100" filter_blur_hover="0" last="no"][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Finding an affordable home to live in can be difficult, and finding an affordable home for someone with a disability or modifying your house for someone with a disability can be even harder and more financially straining. However, there are a few resources that can aid in your search for a place to live, along with programs and services that can make your home accessible and easier to live in. We have listed a few of these resources below:[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]

To start, contact your local U.S. Department of Housing & Urban Development (HUD) Office. You can search for one near your home on their site.  HUD can provide you with more information on affordable housing and can assist you in finding affordable housing programs in your state such as Section 811 Supportive Housing for Persons with Disabilities

[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]HUD also provides access to a number of resources, programs, and information to help you with finding housing, renting, and paying for housing depending on your financial situation:[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]
  • Affordable Apartment Search
  • Get Advice on Buying a Home, Renting, Foreclosures & Credit Issues
  • Find Rental Help in Your State
  • What Is Public Housing & Who Is Eligible for It?
  • Local Homeless Assistance Programs
  • Vouchers for persons with Disabilities
  • Information for Disabled Persons
[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]

Eldercare is another resource that can help with modifying your own home so that it is easier and more comfortable to live in for someone with a disability.  This site also offers assistance on how to pay for these changes to your home and well as access to senior care, jobs, and more.

[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]

Volunteers of America is another site that can help find low-income housing programs in your area and well as caregiving.  Simply input your location to see what options are available near you.

[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]

Disability.gov is a site that can help you in your search for disability housing.  They offer access to a number of programs and resources, and can guide you on how to receive financial assistance, where to find housing, and more. 

[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]

We understand that finding and paying for disability housing can be difficult process.  The resources above can help in your search for a home or better living conditions and may alleviate your financial burden.

[/fusion_text][fusion_separator style_type="none" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="" top_margin="10px" bottom_margin="10px" border_size="" icon="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]By: Chantal Bishara[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

filter_invert_hover="0" filter_sepia_hover="0" filter_opacity_hover="100" filter_blur_hover="0" last="no"][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""] Healthcare and homelessness are often somehow connected. About half of homeless have serious health conditions. Most are not being treated. If this is the case for you, these are ways you may be able to get help. [/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Medicaid[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]While Medicaid can be difficult to get when you don’t have a home address, most shelters will help you sign up.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Healthcare for the Homeless programs[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""] There are at least one Healthcare for the Homeless facilities in each state, though there are typically more. You can find a facility near you  here. [/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Homeless Veteran Healthcare Assistance[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Both the Homeless Veteran Health Care and Domiciliary Care for Homeless Veterans program serves homeless veterans in need of healthcare in VA hospitals, housing, and clinics. You can find more information here.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Federally Qualified Health Centers[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""] FQHCs are health care facilities receive grants so that they can help those who would not otherwise be able to afford healthcare. Search for a center near you here. When you’re homeless, healthcare can seem inaccessible. Know that there are programs specifically to help you get the care you need. [/fusion_text][fusion_separator style_type="none" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="" top_margin="10px" bottom_margin="10px" border_size="" icon="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]
By: Alecia Stanton
[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

Title: Top 8 Ways to Get Free and Low Cost Legal Help
Content: [fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" hundred_percent_height="no" hundred_percent_height_scroll="no" hundred_percent_height_center_content="yes" equal_height_columns="no" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""] Lawyers and legal services can cost hundreds, or even thousands. When you simply don’t have the money, it can be hard to know where to turn. Luckily, there are quite a few ways to get help. Here are the top 8: [/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Online Legal Information[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]You can visit websites like Nolo.com and LawHelp.org for information on almost anything legal related. Just make sure that each website is reputable and that it’s information is up-to-date.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Pro Bono Programs[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Some lawyers allot a certain amount of their time and resources to providing free legal services. Check your state’s bar association or the U.S Department of Justice website to find one near you that offers the help you are looking for.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Law School Clinics[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Certain law schools have legal clinics staffed by law students. They are designed to give the students real world experience. Contact your nearest law school to find out if they have a clinic and whether or not they can deal with your specific issue.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Sliding Scale Programs[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]You can find some programs that charge on a sliding scale for legal services. You can find these by a simple online search of sliding scale legal programs in your area. Be aware, that some of these programs only provide sliding scale options for low income individuals.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Legal Aid[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Most communities have some sort of legal aid for those that can’t afford legal services. They provide free legal assistance or representation. Qualifying for this help usually depends on your income as well as a variety of other factors.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Legal Hotlines[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""] These hotlines connect you to legal practitioners and usually charge by the minute. You can get legal advice on most of your legal issues and save lots of money. There typically isn’t an income requirement to use these services. [/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Unbundled Legal Services[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Use a lawyer to handle parts of your matter and do other parts yourself. This is called unbundling legal services. You only pay for the services you are provided, instead of a general fee.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Nonprofits[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Some nonprofits have lawyers on staff to provide legal services to those that cannot otherwise afford it. Finding one near you is as easy as searching “legal help nonprofit in (your state)”. Don’t deny yourself the legal help you need because you don’t have much money. There are organizations and programs created specifically for you. If none of these suggestions work, ask your state’s bar association to guide you to low cost help in your area.[/fusion_text][fusion_separator style_type="none" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="" top_margin="10px" bottom_margin="10px" border_size="" icon="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]By: Alecia Stanton[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

Check your state’s bar association or the U.S Department of Justice website to find one near you that offers the help you are looking for.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Law School Clinics[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Certain law schools have legal clinics staffed by law students. They are designed to give the students real world experience. Contact your nearest law school to find out if they have a clinic and whether or not they can deal with your specific issue.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Sliding Scale Programs[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]

You can find some programs that charge on a sliding scale for legal services. You can find these by a simple online search of sliding scale legal programs in your area. Be aware, that some of these programs only provide sliding scale options for low income individuals.

[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Legal Aid[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]

Most communities have some sort of legal aid for those that can’t afford legal services. They provide free legal assistance or representation. Qualifying for this help usually depends on your income as well as a variety of other factors.

[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Legal Hotlines[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]These hotlines connect you to legal practitioners and usually charge by the minute. You can get legal advice on most of your legal issues and save lots of money. There typically isn’t an income requirement to use these services.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Unbundled Legal Services[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Use a lawyer to handle parts of your matter and do other parts yourself. This is called unbundling legal services. You only pay for the services you are provided, instead of a general fee.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Nonprofits[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Some nonprofits have lawyers on staff to provide legal services to those that cannot otherwise afford it. Finding one near you is as easy as searching “legal help nonprofit in (your state)”. Don’t deny yourself the legal help you need because you don’t have much money. There are organizations and programs created specifically for you. If none of these suggestions work, ask your state’s bar association to guide you to low cost help in your area.[/fusion_text][fusion_separator style_type="none" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="" top_margin="10px" bottom_margin="10px" border_size="" icon="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]By: Alecia Stanton[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

Title: Finding Jobs When Disabled
Content: [fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" hundred_percent_height="no" hundred_percent_height_scroll="no" hundred_percent_height_center_content="yes" equal_height_columns="no" filter_invert_hover="0" filter_sepia_hover="0" filter_opacity_hover="100" filter_blur_hover="0" last="no"][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""] Whether your disability benefits just aren’t enough to make ends meet or you were denied benefits and can’t find a job that will accommodate you, disabilities can greatly impact your ability to make money. The good news is there are now job search options specifically for people with disabilities. Here are four of them: [/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="10px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="0px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""] OPM.gov [/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""] The governments Office of Personnel Management has information regarding how to find employment when you have a disability under the Disability Employment tab. You will also find a Selective Placement Program Coordinator Directory. Get in touch with your local Selective Placement Program Coordinator (SPPC) to find out about jobs for the disabled in your area. [/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="10px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="0px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]USAjobs.gov[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""] This website has a listing of government jobs. When applying, state that you want to apply under Schedule A, which is a hiring authority that allows for the hiring of disabled individuals without them having to compete for it. To clarify, Schedule A is only available for those with “severe mental of physical disability”, though there is no set definition for what this means so it is open to interpretation. [/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="10px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="0px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]AbilityOne.gov[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""] Ability One helps the blind and significantly disabled find employment. You can either use their locator to nonprofits that work with Ability One, or visit their site Careers with Vision (link on webpage). Most of the jobs are for manufacturing and delivering products and services for the Federal Government. [/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="10px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="0px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]NTIatHome.org[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]NTI helps disabled individuals find work they can do from home. This is the best way to find at-home jobs without having to try to figure out which ones are scams. Before applying, check out the Hiring Process Walkthrough so that you know what to expect. Please be advised that if you are receiving Social Security Benefits, you generally cannot make more than $1,130 per month and continue receiving benefits. Calculating your monthly income before accepting a job will help you prevent losing them. Even with this restriction, supplementing your income can make a huge difference. If you do not receive disability benefits, knowing that you can find a job that works with your disability will alleviate so much stress.[/fusion_text][fusion_separator style_type="none" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="" top_margin="10px" bottom_margin="10px" border_size="" icon="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="0px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="0px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]By: Alecia Stanton[/fusion_title][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

Title: How to Find Help With Rent
Content:
[fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" hundred_percent_height="no" hundred_percent_height_scroll="no" hundred_percent_height_center_content="yes" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" background_blend_mode="none" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" filter_type="regular" filter_hue="0" filter_saturation="100" filter_brightness="100" filter_contrast="100" filter_invert="0" filter_sepia="0" filter_opacity="100" filter_blur="0" filter_hue_hover="0" filter_saturation_hover="100" filter_brightness_hover="100" filter_contrast_hover="100" filter_invert_hover="0" filter_sepia_hover="0" filter_opacity_hover="100" filter_blur_hover="0" last="no"][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]

We’ve all run into hard times. When money challenges arise, rent is one of the hardest things to pay. Whether you’re experiencing a hard time right now or making sure you know where to turn in the event that you end up in this position, it is surprisingly difficult to find help. That’s why we’ve compiled four organizations and programs that assist with rent.

[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="10px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="0px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Modest Needs[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]

This program provides short term grants to working individuals and families. They have different grant types and even allow others to donate to you. Applying is fairly easy and done completely online.

[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="10px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="0px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Homelessness Prevention and Rapid Re-Housing Program[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]The U.S Department of Housing and Urban Development’s Homelessness Prevention and Rapid Re-housing Program (HPRP) fights to keep people off the streets and in their homes. Contact your county’s housing authority to find out about the HPRP in your area.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="10px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="0px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Catholic Charities  USA[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]

Catholic Charities has over 160 agencies across the country. They offer many types of assistance, including rent, when funds are available. Contact the agency near you to find out if they help. If you are a member of a religious organization, check with them as well to see if they offer similar assistance.

[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="10px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="0px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]211[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]

This organization helps people search for help with almost any resource imaginable. You can search for rent assistance in your area. If you’d prefer to speak to someone directly, you can call them at 2-1-1.

If you are having trouble paying your rent, you don’t have to suffer in silence. Although it may be a little harder to find, help is available.

[/fusion_text][fusion_separator style_type="none" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="" top_margin="10px" bottom_margin="10px" border_size="" icon="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="0px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="0px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]By: Alecia Stanton[/fusion_title][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

Title: 3 Inventions Made By African Americans That Are Helping You Save Money
Content:
[fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" hundred_percent_height="no" hundred_percent_height_scroll="no" hundred_percent_height_center_content="yes" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" status="published" publish_date="" class="" id="" border_size="" border_color="" border_style="solid" margin_top="" margin_bottom="" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" gradient_start_color="" gradient_end_color="" gradient_start_position="0" gradient_end_position="100" gradient_type="linear" radial_direction="center" linear_angle="180" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="center center" background_repeat="no-repeat" fade="no" background_parallax="none" enable_mobile="no" parallax_speed="0.3" background_blend_mode="none" video_mp4="" video_webm="" video_ogv="" video_url="" video_aspect_ratio="16:9" video_loop="yes" video_mute="yes" video_preview_image="" filter_hue="0" filter_saturation="100" filter_brightness="100" filter_contrast="100" filter_invert="0" filter_sepia="0" filter_opacity="100" filter_blur="0" filter_hue_hover="0" filter_saturation_hover="100" filter_brightness_hover="100" filter_contrast_hover="100" filter_invert_hover="0" filter_sepia_hover="0" filter_opacity_hover="100" filter_blur_hover="0"][fusion_builder_row][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" spacing="" center_content="no" link="" target="_self" min_height="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" hover_type="none" border_size="0" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" border_radius="" box_shadow="no" dimension_box_shadow="" box_shadow_blur="0" box_shadow_spread="0" box_shadow_color="" box_shadow_style="" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="" background_type="single" gradient_start_color="" gradient_end_color="" gradient_start_position="0" gradient_end_position="100" gradient_type="linear" radial_direction="center" linear_angle="180" background_color="" background_image="" background_image_id="" background_position="left top" background_repeat="no-repeat" background_blend_mode="none" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" filter_type="regular" filter_hue="0" filter_saturation="100" filter_brightness="100" filter_contrast="100" filter_invert="0" filter_sepia="0" filter_opacity="100" filter_blur="0" filter_hue_hover="0" filter_saturation_hover="100" filter_brightness_hover="100" filter_contrast_hover="100" filter_invert_hover="0" filter_sepia_hover="0" filter_opacity_hover="100" filter_blur_hover="0" last="no"][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]

There are a multitude of inventions and advances that have come from African Americans. From gas masks to blood banks to peanut butter, these contributions have saved lives and made life easier. But have you ever wondered which ones are actually keeping money in your pocket? Here are just three:

[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Who: Jan Matzeliger What: Automatic Shoe Laster How It’s Saving You Money: Shoe lasting is the process of stretching fabric around a mold and attaching it to the soles. Before Jan Matzeliger’s automatic shoe lasting machine, professional shoe lasters did it by hand. The work took a lot of time and effort, so shoe lasters were paid a lot of money. This made shoes expensive. With the automatic shoe laster, shoes became much more affordable.[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Who: Lewis Latimer What: Carbon Light Bulb Filament How It’s Saving You Money: The filament is the part of the light bulb that burns and creates light. Before Latimer’s carbon filament, Thomas Edison was using paper as a filament, which burned out in about fifteen minutes. Because of the carbon filament, we don’t have to buy large quantities of light bulbs and change them every fifteen minutes.[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Who: Ludwick Marishane What: DryBath How It’s Saving You Money: This is a new invention created by a young man from Limpopo, South Africa. He created an antibacterial cleanser that cleans and moisturizes the skin without being washed off. It is especially useful for those with limited access to water and offers a cheap way to get clean. Problems such as the ones faced by the inventors above tend to bring out the creativity in some. Their creativity has made life easier and less expensive for many people. These, too, are the people we celebrate during Black History Month.[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]

Problems such as the ones faced by the inventors above tend to bring out the creativity in some. Their creativity has made life easier and less expensive for many people. These, too, are the people we celebrate during Black History Month.

[/fusion_text][fusion_separator style_type="none" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="" top_margin="10px" bottom_margin="10px" border_size="" icon="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]
Find more Articles, Resources and Benefits for Parents at AmericanHopeResources.com.
By Alecia Stanton of American Hope Resources
[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

Title: 5 Best Ways to Improve Your Job Search
Content: [fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" hundred_percent_height="no" hundred_percent_height_scroll="no" hundred_percent_height_center_content="yes" equal_height_columns="no" filter_invert_hover="0" filter_sepia_hover="0" filter_opacity_hover="100" filter_blur_hover="0" last="no"][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""] Job searching is tedious for almost everyone. When you feel like you’re doing everything you can but still not getting hired, you may wonder what else you could possibly do. Try out these 5 tips to jumpstart your search. [/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]1. Clean Up Your Social Media[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""] Whether we like it or not, social media has become a part of everyday life. [/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]2. Network[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""] Networking is included in every job tip list for a reason: it works and it works well! Networking is more than just letting everyone you come across know that you are looking for a job, though you may want to do that as well. It’s about creating and maintaining connections. Show interest in your connections beyond what they can do for you. [/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]3. Review Your Resume[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Can you scan your resume in 15 seconds and identify what value you can add to a company? Are there spelling or grammar mistakes? These are the types of things you want to look for when you look over your resume. Make sure that it is clear and concise.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]4. Use a Professional Sounding Email Address[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Make sure that your email address reflects professionalism. Avoid cutesy or offensive usernames. Email addresses like sexybunny20@gmail.com or greatestgrandma@yahoo.com aren’t your best bet. It’s best to stick with using your name.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]5. Find Free or Low Cost Job Training[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]You can find job training programs at junior colleges and adult schools for a relatively small amount of money. There are also websites like Alison.com and  Udemy.com that offer free and inexpensive classes and certification courses for almost anything you can imagine. Learn skills you can add to your resume or get certified for a whole new career! It’s easy to feel hopeless when you are searching for a job, but don’t give up. There are always new methods and tricks you can try. If what you’re doing isn’t helping you find a new job, consider something else.[/fusion_text][fusion_separator style_type="none" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="" top_margin="10px" bottom_margin="10px" border_size="" icon="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""] By: Alecia Stanton [/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

Title: Job Resources For Seniors

animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" filter_type="regular" filter_hue="0" filter_saturation="100" filter_brightness="100" filter_contrast="100" filter_invert_hover="0" filter_sepia_hover="0" filter_opacity_hover="100" filter_blur_hover="0" last="no"][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]More and more seniors are looking for work. Maybe your retirement income isn’t enough, or you’ve never been able to retire to begin with. It’s also possible that you simply miss working. Regardless of your reasons, it can be challenging to find work as a senior. Here are some resources that might improve your odds.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="10px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="0px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]AARP[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]You already know about AARP’s membership program, but their website has free articles on a variety of topics, including job hunting. They also created the Back To Work 50+ program, which connects seniors with information, training, and other resources to help with employment.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="10px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="0px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Workforce50 [/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Workforce50 is a great site for seniors looking to enter the job market. One of their most popular resources is a list of senior-friendly employers. You can also find articles on how to avoid age bias on your resume and how to navigate a career transition, along with more general advice for seniors.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="10px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="0px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Retiree Workforce[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Retiree Workforce is another option that you should take advantage of. Like Workforce50, this website allows you to search jobs and get advice from blog articles. They also have a coupon section, which, while not directly related to retirement, will help you save money.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="10px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="0px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Retired Brains[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]This site has a lot of great articles on retirement and gives an in-depth look at the types of jobs that are well-suited for seniors.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="10px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="0px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Indeed[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]This isn’t strictly geared toward seniors, but it’s the most popular job-hunting site on the internet. Simply enter what kind of job you’re looking for (which can be the job title, company name, or anything else related to the type of work you’d like to perform) and your location, and start browsing! There may be some overlap with these resources, but using all of them will increase your chances of finding employment. You may not see any results for a while, but try to stay positive. Best of luck on your search![/fusion_text][fusion_separator style_type="none" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="" top_margin="10px" bottom_margin="10px" border_size="" icon="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="0px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="0px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]By Luke Smith[/fusion_title][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

filter_invert="0" filter_sepia="0" filter_opacity="100" filter_blur="0" filter_hue_hover="0" filter_saturation_hover="100" filter_brightness_hover="100" filter_contrast_hover="100" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Winter weather means a major hike in energy costs for most. There are steps you can take to make keeping warm less expensive, though. Below are nine easy, free ways to cut your energy bill expenses.[/fusion_text][fusion_code][/fusion_code][fusion_separator style_type="none" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="" top_margin="10px" bottom_margin="10px" border_size="" icon="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Replace Overlooked Household Items :[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Buy energy-efficient LED bulbs instead of cheaper incandescent bulbs and replace your shower head with a low-flow version. These energy-saving items can cut down on your energy bill in the long run.[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]These are the simplest ways to keep your home warm. Weatherization is also an effective solution but is often costly. You can use these tips throughout the winter or just until you can get your home weatherized. Either way, it saves you money![/fusion_text][fusion_separator style_type="none" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="" top_margin="10px" bottom_margin="10px" border_size="" icon="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]By: Alecia Stanton[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

filter_invert="0" filter_sepia="0" filter_opacity="100" filter_blur="0" filter_hue_hover="0" filter_saturation_hover="100" filter_brightness_hover="100" filter_contrast_hover="100" filter_invert_hover="0" filter_sepia_hover="0" filter_opacity_hover="100" filter_blur_hover="0" last="no"][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]

Winter can wreak havoc on your electricity and gas bills. Although we would all like to blast the heat in our house all day, most of us can’t afford it or don’t have working heating units at all. That doesn’t mean you have to choose between freezing and not having enough money for food. Try these cheap and easy home heating tricks to keep cozy without the hefty cost.

[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Use A Space Heater[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]

If you and your family are only in one room, use a space heater. They use much less energy and will cost you less than turning the heat on for the whole house.

[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Use The Curtains[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]When the sun is out, open the curtains to let it naturally heat your home. Close them when the sun goes down to lock the heat in.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Reverse The Direction Of Your Ceiling Fan[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]There is a switch on every ceiling fan that allows you to change the direction that it spins. By reversing the direction, your fan will push warm air down, heating your home.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Install A Programmable Thermostat[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]These units cost as little as $20 and can save you lots of money. By being able to program the temperature for when you are home or away, you can save energy while you’re not home without having to turn it all the way off.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Use The Oven[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]After cooking or baking, open the oven to let the heat out into the house. It will mostly heat the kitchen, but can make for a cozy dinnertime. For extra warmth, wear warm, cozy clothes and make sure your home doesn’t have any holes that cold air can get into. Don’t let a limited budget keep you from staying warm this winter. Fighting off the cold is easier and less expensive than you think.[/fusion_text][fusion_separator style_type="none" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="" top_margin="10px" bottom_margin="10px" border_size="" icon="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]By: Alecia Stanton[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

Title: Where to Find Help Paying Bills
Content:
[fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" hundred_percent_height="no" hundred_percent_height_scroll="no" hundred_percent_height_center_content="yes" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" video_mute="yes" video_preview_image="" filter_hue="0" filter_saturation="100" filter_brightness="100" filter_contrast="100" filter_invert="0" filter_sepia="0" filter_opacity="100" filter_blur="0" filter_hue_hover="0" filter_saturation_hover="100" filter_brightness_hover="100" filter_contrast_hover="100" filter_invert_hover="0" filter_sepia_hover="0" filter_opacity_hover="100"
