box_shadow="no" dimension_box_shadow="" box_shadow_blur="0" box_shadow_spread="0" box_shadow_color="" box_shadow_style="" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="" background_type="single" gradient_start_color="" gradient_end_color="" gradient_start_position="0" gradient_end_position="100" gradient_type="linear" radial_direction="center" linear_angle="180" background_color="" background_image="" background_image_id="" background_position="left top" background_repeat="no-repeat" background_blend_mode="none" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" filter_type="regular" filter_hue="0" filter_saturation="100" filter_brightness="100" filter_contrast="100" filter_invert="0" filter_sepia="0" filter_opacity="100" filter_blur="0" filter_hue_hover="0" filter_saturation_hover="100" filter_brightness_hover="100" filter_contrast_hover="100" filter_invert_hover="0" filter_sepia_hover="0" filter_opacity_hover="100" filter_blur_hover="0" last="no"][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""] You may think that you can’t get a checking account due to your credit score but it actually a consequence of a low ChexSystems risk score. ChexSystems is a reporting system similar to credit reporting except it reports on bank account activity. Each time you have a bank account closed due to high, unpaid overdrafts or fraud, your ChexSystems risk score drops.When you apply for a new bank account, the bank will check your score to determine whether or not you are eligible to bank with them. If you have a low ChexSystems risk score, you will have a hard time opening a checking account because banks consider you a high risk. After being declined by multiple banks, the situation may seem hopeless but you can still get a checking account. One option is to repair you ChexSystems risk score. Order a copy of your consumer disclosure report here to view the items on your record. You can order a free report every 12 months. Scan your report for any mistakes. If you find them dispute it. Next, pay off the debts listed on your report. Once an item is paid of off, it will be removed from your report. Your next option is to open a second chance checking account. These accounts have monthly fees but are offered to those that are unable to get a regular checking account. Most of them will offer you an upgrade to a regular checking account after building good rapport with your second chance account for a certain period of time. Nerd Wallet has a great list of second chance checking accounts available in each state and nationwide. If all else fails, you can get a prepaid card. These do not come with the perks of a checking account but can still be worth at least looking into. An increasing number of banks are now offering prepaid cards because they are realizing their value. American Express even offers one! As prepaid cards become more popular, they are including more features. Most of them allow direct deposit and Paypal's prepaid card that you can link to your Paypal account so that you can transfer money with ease. If you can’t get a regular bank account, prepaid cards are a pretty solid option. When you are unable to get a checking account, don’t give up. If you have the time and money, repair your ChexSystems risk score. If you need to get an account immediately, and are confident in your ability to handle an account at this time, open a second chance checking account. If you know that your banking habits aren’t great yet, get a prepaid card, which you can’t overdraft. Just because you have been denied a regular checking account, it doesn’t mean you don’t have options. [/fusion_text][fusion_separator style_type="none" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="" top_margin="10px" bottom_margin="10px" border_size="" icon="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]By: Alecia Stanton[/fusion_title][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

Title: Preserving Your Marriage During Financial Hardship
Content:
[fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" hundred_percent_height="no" hundred_percent_height_scroll="no" hundred_percent_height_center_content="yes" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="" background_type="single" gradient_start_color="" gradient_end_color="" gradient_start_position="0" gradient_end_position="100" gradient_type="linear" radial_direction="center" linear_angle="180" background_color="" background_image="" background_image_id="" background_position="left top" background_repeat="no-repeat" background_blend_mode="none" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" filter_type="regular" filter_hue="0" filter_saturation="100" filter_brightness="100" filter_contrast="100" filter_invert="0" filter_sepia="0" filter_opacity="100" filter_blur="0" filter_hue_hover="0" filter_saturation_hover="100" filter_brightness_hover="100" filter_contrast_hover="100" filter_invert_hover="0" filter_sepia_hover="0" filter_opacity_hover="100" filter_blur_hover="0" last="no"][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]

When the going gets tough, it is only natural for relationships to be affected.  Especially during financial hardship, a couple’s marriage may start to deteriorate as emotions and economic stress become a burden and detrimental to the relationship.  Here are some ways to rebuild the relationship with your partner so that you can fight for your marriage in order to combat your financial issues together as a team.

[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Confront the problem[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Before you can combat an issue, you need to admit that there is one. Sometimes couples shy away from admitting that their relationship is at strain and think that avoiding it will make the problem go away. But often times, this only creates disconnect and allows for the issue to grow. It is okay to admit that your relationship is not what it should be because of financial stress, and being open and honest with your partner only reaffirms the importance of your relationship. Decide to have serious conversation and to fight for your marriage, because talking it through is the first step to fixing the problem.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Fight the problem, not each other[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]When talking through your issues, it is important to attack your problems, not each other. Do not spend time blaming each other for your current financial situation. You cannot take back what you say or what has happened in the past, so focus on the issue at hand and your future. Work as a team, and decide to commit to mending your relationship to become a stronger force against your economic hardship. Focus on loving and being there for each other and that no matter what happens financially, the important thing is that you have each other. In fact, doing this will change your mindset and create positivity within the relationship, which will make facing your financial issues easier.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Plan for the future[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Create a plan for the future so that you do not fall into the same economic hardship and develop relationship issues ever again. As a team, you can now work together and think clearer to find solutions to your financial crisis. You can now communicate as partners and understand what went wrong, and therefore formulate a solution to your current problems and prevent any future ones from happening. Focus to work to keep your finances in order and as a result, your relationship with your partner will rebuild, become stronger, and will no longer become strained due to financial stress.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Have some fun[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]During financially hard times, often couples forget to have fun. It can be because their relationship is on the line, they are too focused and stressed about their economic issues and feel they have no time or cannot enjoy their life until this is resolved, or because they simply cannot afford it. When money is tight, it is even more important to take the time to enjoy and spend time with your partner. It doesn’t have to be anything extravagant or expensive like taking a vacation to the Bahamas. You can simply go to the movies, have a date night, take a walk, or play a board game. Anything to laugh and to spend some time enjoying each other’s company without thinking or talking about your financial struggle. You’ll feel better, connect with your spouse, and remember to live your life and have fun regardless of the finances. For richer or for poorer, you and your spouse are in it together. When financial hardship puts a strain on your marriage, it is important to fight for the relationship in order to combat your issues together as partners. You have vowed to be there for each other through thick and thin, and if you focus on your commitment to each other, your economic downfall will only be a small bump within your relationship.[/fusion_text][fusion_separator style_type="none" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="" top_margin="10px" bottom_margin="10px" border_size="" icon="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]By: Chantal Bishara[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

Title: Free Laptops
Content:
[fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" hundred_percent_height="no" hundred_percent_height_scroll="no" hundred_percent_height_center_content="yes" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" box_shadow="no" dimension_box_shadow="" box_shadow_blur="0" box_shadow_spread="0" box_shadow_color="" box_shadow_style="" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="" background_type="single" gradient_start_color="" gradient_end_color="" gradient_start_position="0" gradient_end_position="100" gradient_type="linear" radial_direction="center" linear_angle="180" background_color="" background_image="" background_image_id="" background_position="left top" background_repeat="no-repeat" background_blend_mode="none" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" filter_type="regular" filter_hue="0" filter_saturation="100" filter_brightness="100" filter_contrast="100" filter_invert="0" filter_sepia="0" filter_opacity="100" filter_blur="0" filter_hue_hover="0" filter_saturation_hover="100" filter_brightness_hover="100" filter_contrast_hover="100" filter_invert_hover="0" filter_sepia_hover="0" filter_opacity_hover="100" filter_blur_hover="0" last="no"][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Laptops are very expensive, and when you’re on a budget, buying one may seem out of the question. However, finding a laptop or computer for a very low price or even FREE is not as hard as it sounds. In fact, there are a number of sites designed so that you can find one for a discounted price.[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]A lot of times these sites are selling refurbished laptops and other electronics as opposed to brand new items. It is important to take caution, because unfortunately it is easy to be scammed or receive a broken laptop.[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]A site where you can start your search for a free laptop is FreeLaptops.com. Just type in the search bar exactly what you are looking for on the site, and a number of options will appear. Sometimes options are limited, so it might be easier to simply type in “free laptop” to see what comes up.[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Craigslist and eBay are two other sites that often sell laptops and computers for very low prices. Again, it is all about chance, so search to see what options are available to you. It’s always a good idea to check out seller history & buyer feedback to make sure that you are buying your laptop from a trustworthy source.[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Online contests & sweepstakes are also a great way to get a free laptop or computer. Though they are rare, they often give away free electronics as prizes (sometimes even brand new). Search for ones that you can possibly participate in. Facebook & Twitter contests or just searching “Contest with free computer” online may work. Who knows, you might be the lucky winner![/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]

Finding a free or discounted laptop or computer can seem difficult if you don’t know where to look. With a little online searching in the right places however, you might find one for a great price!

[/fusion_text][fusion_separator style_type="none" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="" top_margin="10px" bottom_margin="10px" border_size="" icon="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]By: Chantal Bishara[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

Title: Free Cell Phone Plans
Content:
[fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" hundred_percent_height="no" hundred_percent_height_scroll="no" hundred_percent_height_center_content="yes" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" status="published" publish_date="" class="" id="" border_size="" border_color="" border_style="solid" margin_top="" box_shadow="no" dimension_box_shadow="" box_shadow_blur="0" box_shadow_spread="0" box_shadow_color="" box_shadow_style="" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="" background_type="single" gradient_start_color="" gradient_end_color="" gradient_start_position="0" gradient_end_position="100" gradient_type="linear" radial_direction="center" linear_angle="180" background_color="" background_image="" background_image_id="" background_position="left top" background_repeat="no-repeat" background_blend_mode="none" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" filter_type="regular" filter_hue="0" filter_saturation="100" filter_brightness="100" filter_contrast="100" filter_invert="0" filter_sepia="0" filter_opacity="100" filter_blur="0" filter_hue_hover="0" filter_saturation_hover="100" filter_brightness_hover="100" filter_contrast_hover="100" filter_invert_hover="0" filter_sepia_hover="0" filter_opacity_hover="100" filter_blur_hover="0" last="no"][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]When many spend $100 and more on their cell phone plans, it’s hard to believe that you can actually get them for free. Most of these free cell phone plans require you to receive Lifeline Support (you can check eligibility here) , others simply offer a specific, often lower, amount of minutes, texts, and data. Still, if you are in need of cell phone service but can’t pay the usual prices, the following cell phone plans are definitely worth looking into.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="10px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="0px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]FreedomPop[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]

This mobile phone service promotes itself as the first one to offer free plans. They also offer a fairly wide selection of phones, including smartphones.
Free monthly plan includes:
500MB of data
500 texts
200 minutes
No contract

[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="10px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="0px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Budget Mobile[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]This is one of the Lifeline carriers and will ask if you are receiving Lifeline assistance as a part of the eligibility process. Free monthly plan includes: 350 minutes 350 texts *For a limited time you can get a free smartphone with 500 minutes and 500 texts for the first three months. After this period, your free plan is switched to the one above.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="10px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="0px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Assurance Wireless[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Assurance is also a Lifeline carrier through Virgin Mobile. Although it is unclear, it seems the cell phone is not a smartphone, although it is free. Free monthly plan includes 500 minutes for first 4 months 350 minutes after Unlimited texts No contract[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]While there may be many other carriers offering free plans, these are the most easily accessible. There is one honorable mention that did not make the list because it’s accompanying cell phone, the Coolpad Arise, is currently discontinued for redesign: Scratch Wireless. It phone uses a wi-fi first technology that limits the amount of data you use. The re-release date hasn’t been announced, but the free service and $99 phone is worth looking out for.[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]

Getting Lifeline assistance will make it much easier to get a free phone plan. It is a government run program that assists low-income individuals get cell phones and stay connected. To qualify you must be at or below 135 percent of the federal poverty guidelines. If you are receiving other government aid, it may also qualify you for assistance. Again, you check eligibility and apply here.

[/fusion_text][fusion_separator style_type="none" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="" top_margin="10px" bottom_margin="10px" border_size="" icon="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="0px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="0px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]By: Alecia Stanton[/fusion_title][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

Title: Two Important United Way Services
Content:
[fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" hundred_percent_height="no" hundred_percent_height_scroll="no" hundred_percent_height_center_content="yes" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" hover_type="none" border_size="0" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" border_radius="" box_shadow="no" dimension_box_shadow="" box_shadow_blur="0" box_shadow_spread="0" box_shadow_color="" box_shadow_style="" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="" background_type="single" gradient_start_color="" gradient_end_color="" gradient_start_position="0" gradient_end_position="100" gradient_type="linear" radial_direction="center" linear_angle="180" background_color="" background_image="" background_image_id="" background_position="left top" background_repeat="no-repeat" background_blend_mode="none" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" filter_type="regular" filter_hue="0" filter_saturation="100" filter_brightness="100" filter_contrast="100" filter_invert="0" filter_sepia="0" filter_opacity="100" filter_blur="0" filter_hue_hover="0" filter_saturation_hover="100" filter_brightness_hover="100" filter_contrast_hover="100" filter_invert_hover="0" filter_sepia_hover="0" filter_opacity_hover="100" filter_blur_hover="0" last="no"][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]United Way is one of the largest human service nonprofits in the united states. They have six different programs and initiatives to help people experiencing different types of hardships. While most of them are good to know about, there are two services that are especially useful for those in financial hardship.[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]The first, and most important, service is called 2-1-1. It is both a hotline and a website designed to guide those in need to local resources. The hotline runs 24 hours a day, 7 days a week so you can call any time. They have information for a long list of resources including food, shelter, employment, health care, and ex-offender help.[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]The second is especially helpful during tax season. It’s called MyFreeTaxes and provides free tax preparation to those that make less than $62,000. You can file them online or search for a tax filing volunteer in your area.[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]

The information regarding these and their four other programs can be found on their website. You will also find information about their mission and find a location in your area.

[/fusion_text][fusion_separator style_type="none" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="" top_margin="10px" bottom_margin="10px" border_size="" icon="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

Title: 5 Places to Find Free Appliances
Content: [fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" hundred_percent_height="no" hundred_percent_height_scroll="no" hundred_percent_height_center_content="yes" equal_height_columns="no" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" filter_type="regular" filter_hue="0" filter_saturation="100" filter_brightness="100" filter_contrast="100" filter_invert="0" filter_sepia="0" filter_opacity="100" filter_blur="0" filter_hue_hover="0" filter_saturation_hover="100" filter_brightness_hover="100" filter_contrast_hover="100" filter_invert_hover="0" filter_sepia_hover="0" filter_opacity_hover="100" filter_blur_hover="0" last="no"][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Appliances can be the most expensive items in your home. Some, like a toaster, you can live without. But others, like a refrigerator, are non negotiable. If you’re in need of new appliances but don’t have the money, try these 5 places.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]LIHEAP[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]The Low Income Home Energy Assistance Program offers assistance with heating and cooling costs to low income households. In participating states, this program also provides those in need with free appliances. To qualify you must be below the poverty line or disabled.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Freecycle[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Freecycle allows people to give away their unwanted items to others in their community. Simply create a free account, find the group for your area, and search the posts. You can also post a “Wanted” listing to ask for what you need.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Churches/Charities[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Some churches have a collection of appliances, as well as clothing and shoes, for low income individuals. Others will ask for donations of appliances for you. Charities may either provide you with donated appliances or the money to get what you need.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Craigslist[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]You can find almost anything on Craigslist for free or cheap. Be sure to check that any appliance you are looking to buy is in working order before you hand over the money. Meet in a public places with a power outlet you can use, for your safety.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Furniture Banks[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]While the name of these types of nonprofits suggest that they only provide furniture, most also have appliances. Call ahead of time and ask if they have what you need available. This is convenient if you are also in need of furniture. You don’t have to go with appliances just because you don’t have the money. There are people and organizations that understand the necessity of these needs and seek to help.[/fusion_text][fusion_separator style_type="none" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="" top_margin="10px" bottom_margin="10px" border_size="" icon="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]By: Alecia Stanton[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

Title: How to Get SNAP Benefits
Content:
[fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" hundred_percent_height="no" hundred_percent_height_scroll="no" hundred_percent_height_center_content="yes" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]The most widely known food assistance program in the United States is the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program, or SNAP. However, figuring out how to receive these benefits can be tricky sometimes. If you’re having a hard time feeding yourself and/or your family, follow these steps:[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]

Check Eligibility
Before applying, you will want to make sure you have a good chance of getting accepted. Some states provide a prescreening tool on their website. You can find state SNAP benefit pages here. There is also a federal screening tool here. If you are receiving TANF, SSI, or other government assistance, you can skip this step.

[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Apply
You can either apply or at your local SNAP office, depending on your state. The application process is fairly quick and simple. Double check it when you are done to make sure that all of your information is correct; this could be the difference between whether your application is accepted or denied.[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Interview
Your caseworker will schedule an interview in which you will explain your situation to them. You may need to bring two forms of identification, proof of income, and gas, power, and/or water bills. Make sure to ask your caseworker what you will need prior to the appointment.[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Wait
Applications can take up to 30 days to process. Make sure to return requested documents as soon as possible, as this can delay the process. Most states will deny your application if you don’t return them in a specified amount of time. A overstretched workload can also delay your application process time[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Receive Benefits
If you are approved, you will receive your card and benefits within 30 days of approval. Don’t be alarmed if you receive your card with a $0 balance. Your benefits will soon be deposited.[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Once you have received your benefits, you may use them at most grocery stores as well as some restaurants and convenience stores. Remember that alcohol, tobacco, toiletries, and cleaning supplies are not eligible for purchase with your SNAP benefits. However, you may use your benefits to buy seeds so that you can grow your own food![/fusion_text][fusion_separator style_type="none" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="" top_margin="10px" bottom_margin="10px" border_size="" icon="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]By: Alecia Stanton[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

[fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" hundred_percent_height="no" hundred_percent_height_scroll="no" hundred_percent_height_center_content="yes" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" filter_invert="0" filter_sepia="0" filter_opacity="100" filter_blur="0" filter_hue_hover="0" filter_saturation_hover="100" filter_brightness_hover="100" filter_contrast_hover="100" filter_invert_hover="0" filter_sepia_hover="0" filter_opacity_hover="100" filter_blur_hover="0" last="no"][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]

When you’re homeless, getting the bare essentials may seem impossible. It can feel as though you are forgotten or that no one cares about you. But there are people and organizations all across the nation that have made it their mission to help you. Here’s These directories will show you where to find them.

[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="10px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="0px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]

HomelessShelterDirectory.org

[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]As you know, finding a safe place to go is top priority. Not only will shelters put a roof over your head, but most offer food and assistance with employment, clothes/shoes, and healthcare. Some will even provide transportation services to doctors appointments or interviews.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="10px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="0px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]FoodPantries.org[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Food may be an even higher priority than shelter. This food pantry directory also lists soup kitchens and food banks so that you can have something to eat even if you don’t have any money.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="10px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="0px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]NHCHC.org[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Being homeless leaves you vulnerable to illness while having very little access to healthcare. The National Health Care for the Homeless Council awards grants to program that provide healthcare to the homeless. Check their directory for a program near you.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="10px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="0px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]VA.gov[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]If you’re a veteran, you can get help with housing, employment and more from the U.S Department of Veterans Affairs. Their website provides links to service information as well as a phone number to call for assistance.[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]No matter the reason for your homelessness, there is help. Things may seem hard sometimes and you might question whether or not you can go on. You can! Remind yourself of this as often as possible.[/fusion_text][fusion_separator style_type="none" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="" top_margin="10px" bottom_margin="10px" border_size="" icon="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="0px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="0px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]By: Alecia Stanton[/fusion_title][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

animation_offset=""]Sometimes, improving your financial situation is just a matter of knowing how. The internet has made it easier than ever to learn almost anything, including how to deal with your finances. If you feel lost when it comes to your finances or simply feel you don’t know as much as you could, check out these free resources:[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="10px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="0px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Dave Ramsey[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]As a radio personality and best-selling author, Dave Ramsey has become a big name in the personal finance world. His “7 Baby Steps” outlines an easy to understand method to help you get out of debt and start creating wealth.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="10px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="0px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Practical Money Skills[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]This website has a wide variety of articles and resources to help with all sorts of financial situations. From calculators to videos, you will most likely be able to find something useful here.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="10px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="0px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Mint[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]In recent years, Mint has become an increasingly popular money management tool. You can check your credit score, create and view your budget, see how much you’re spending all in one place. They even have an app![/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="10px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="0px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]

Free Online Classes

[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]

Most online learning centers have free personal finance courses. Try the Introduction to Managing Your Personal Finance Debts course from Alison, or Coursera’s Personal and Family Financial Planning course.

With so many options, learning how to manage your finances has never been easier. If you would prefer face-to-face instruction, many adult schools and credit counselors offer education for free or a minimal cost.

[/fusion_text][fusion_separator style_type="none" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="" top_margin="10px" bottom_margin="10px" border_size="" icon="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="0px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="0px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]By: Alecia Stanton[/fusion_title][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

Title: Taxes and Health Insurance
Content:
[fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" hundred_percent_height="no" hundred_percent_height_scroll="no" hundred_percent_height_center_content="yes" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" status="published" publish_date="" class="" id="" border_size="" border_color="" border_style="solid" margin_top="" background_parallax="none" enable_mobile="no" parallax_speed="0.3" background_blend_mode="none" video_mp4="" video_webm="" video_ogv="" video_url="" video_aspect_ratio="16:9" video_loop="yes" video_mute="yes" video_preview_image="" filter_hue="0" filter_saturation="100" filter_brightness="100" filter_contrast="100" filter_invert="0" filter_sepia="0" filter_opacity="100" filter_blur="0" filter_hue_hover="0" filter_saturation_hover="100" filter_brightness_hover="100" filter_contrast_hover="100" filter_invert_hover="0" filter_sepia_hover="0" filter_opacity_hover="100" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" hover_type="none" border_size="0" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" border_radius="" box_shadow="no" dimension_box_shadow="" box_shadow_blur="0" box_shadow_spread="0" box_shadow_color="" box_shadow_style="" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="" background_type="single" gradient_start_color="" gradient_end_color="" gradient_start_position="0" gradient_end_position="100" gradient_type="linear" radial_direction="center" linear_angle="180" background_color="" background_image="" background_image_id="" background_position="left top" background_repeat="no-repeat" background_blend_mode="none" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" filter_type="regular" filter_hue="0" filter_saturation="100" filter_brightness="100" filter_contrast="100" filter_invert="0" filter_sepia="0" filter_opacity="100" filter_blur="0" filter_hue_hover="0" filter_saturation_hover="100" filter_brightness_hover="100" filter_contrast_hover="100" filter_invert_hover="0" filter_sepia_hover="0" filter_opacity_hover="100" filter_blur_hover="0" last="no"][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Confused about how your health insurance affects your taxes? You’re not alone. Because the Affordable Care Act is still fairly new, many are not familiar with all the rules and regulations. Here is the information you need to know.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Acceptable Types of Coverage [/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]
  • Any insurance purchased through the Health Insurance Marketplace
  • “Grandfathered” individual plans from March 23rd, 2010 or earlier
  • Job based plans
  • Medicare part A or B
  • Medicaid, except for limited coverage plans
  • Children’s Health Insurance Program (CHIP)
  • Coverage under a parent's plan
  • Most student health plans
  • Peace Corps volunteer coverage
  • Some types of veteran health coverage
  • Most Tricare plans
  • Department of Defense Nonappropriated fund health benefits program
  • Refugee Medical Assistance
  • State High Risk pools for plans or policy years that started on or before December 31st, 2014
[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Unacceptable Types of Coverage[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]
  • Vision or dental only
  • Workers compensation
  • Coverage for only a specific disease or condition
  • Medical service discount plans
[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Penalties[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""] Higher of
  • $325 or
  • 2%
  • Penalty will go up to $695 or 2.5% for 2016 taxes
  • If you did not have coverage for only part of the year, the penalty is 1/12 of the annual amount for each month you were not covered
[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Tax Payment Exemptions[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]
  • Uninsured for less than three months
  • Lowest priced coverage costs more than 8% of your income
  • You don’t need to file because of low income
  • Your (recognized) religion objects to insurance
  • You are in a recognized health sharing ministry
  • You are Native American and eligible for services through an Indian Health Services provider
  • You are not a U.S citizen, U.S national, or lawfully present alien
  • You are incarcerated
[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Hardship Exemptions[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]
  • Filed for bankruptcy in the last six months
  • Were homeless
  • Had medical expenses you could not pay in the last 2 years
  • Are a recent victim of domestic violence
  • Had an individual plan cancelled and could not afford other Marketplace plans
  • Suffered from a fire, flood, or other natural or human caused disaster that substantially damaged your property
Tax season ends on April 18th, 2016 so make sure to get yours done in time. To avoid paying penalties on 2016 taxes, check to see if you qualify for a special enrollment. [/fusion_text][fusion_separator style_type="none" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="" top_margin="10px" bottom_margin="10px" border_size="" icon="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]By: Alecia Stanton[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

Title: Tax Credits and Deductions You Should Know About
Content:
[fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" hundred_percent_height="no" hundred_percent_height_scroll="no" hundred_percent_height_center_content="yes" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" status="published" publish_date="" class="" id="" border_size="" border_color="" border_style="solid" margin_top="" gradient_type="linear" radial_direction="center" linear_angle="180" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="center center" background_repeat="no-repeat" fade="no" background_parallax="none" enable_mobile="no" parallax_speed="0.3" background_blend_mode="none" video_mp4="" video_webm="" video_ogv="" video_url="" video_aspect_ratio="16:9" video_loop="yes" video_mute="yes" video_preview_image="" filter_hue="0" filter_saturation="100" filter_brightness="100" filter_contrast="100" filter_invert="0" filter_sepia="0" filter_opacity="100" filter_blur="0" filter_hue_hover="0" filter_saturation_hover="100" filter_brightness_hover="100" filter_contrast_hover="100" filter_invert_hover="0" filter_sepia_hover="0" filter_opacity_hover="100" filter_blur_hover="0"][fusion_builder_row][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" spacing="" center_content="no" link="" target="_self" min_height="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" hover_type="none" border_size="0" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" border_radius="" box_shadow="no" dimension_box_shadow="" box_shadow_blur="0" box_shadow_spread="0" box_shadow_color="" box_shadow_style="" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="" background_type="single" gradient_start_color="" gradient_end_color="" gradient_start_position="0" gradient_end_position="100" gradient_type="linear" radial_direction="center" linear_angle="180" background_color="" background_image="" background_image_id="" background_position="left top" background_repeat="no-repeat" background_blend_mode="none" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" filter_type="regular" filter_hue="0" filter_saturation="100" filter_brightness="100" filter_contrast="100" filter_invert="0" filter_sepia="0" filter_opacity="100" filter_blur="0" filter_hue_hover="0" filter_saturation_hover="100" filter_brightness_hover="100" filter_contrast_hover="100" filter_invert_hover="0" filter_sepia_hover="0" filter_opacity_hover="100" filter_blur_hover="0" last="no"][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Tax season is here again. Are you getting all the credits and deductions you qualify for? Here are some that you may not have known about:[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Earned Income Tax Credit [/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]
  • Must be between 25 and 65 years of age
  • Have little or no investment income
  • Have a social security number
  • Have earned income of at least a dollar
  • Can’t file as married filing separately
  • Can’t file 2555 or 2555 ez
[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Lifetime Learning Credit [/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]
  • Must have paid tuition and fee’s to a post-secondary school
  • Modified adjusted gross income of less than $55,000 ($110,000 if filing jointly)
  • Cannot be claimed as a dependant or filing as married filing separately
  • Cannot claim Hope Scholarship Credit for same student
[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Looking for a New Job[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]
  • Tax deductible up to 2% of your gross income
  • Must be looking for a job in your same occupation
  • Can deduct employment and outplacement agency fees
  • Can deduct cost of resumes
  • Cannot deduct expenses if there is a gap between last employment and start of job search
  • Cannot deduct expenses if you are a first time job seeker
[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Credit for the Elderly or Disabled[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]
  • Must be at least 65 years of age or;
  • Retired, on permanent, total disability, and received taxable disability
  • Adjusted gross income must be under limit
[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Savers Credit[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]
  • Have an adjusted gross income under $30,000 ($45,000 for head of household and  $60,000 if married filing separately)
  • Must be saving for retirement
[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Mortgage Interest Credit[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]
  • Have been issued a Mortgage Credit Certificate by qualified local or state government
  • Have a new mortgage
  • Mortgage is for main home
[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Whether you are doing your own taxes or having someone else do them for you, make sure that you get all the tax breaks you qualify for. If someone is doing them for you, look over them to verify that nothing was missed.[/fusion_text][fusion_separator style_type="none" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="" top_margin="10px" bottom_margin="10px" border_size="" icon="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]By: Alecia Stanton[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]
