filter_blur_hover="0"][fusion_builder_row][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" spacing="" center_content="no" link="" target="_self" min_height="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" hover_type="none" border_size="0" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" border_radius="" box_shadow="no" dimension_box_shadow="" box_shadow_blur="0" box_shadow_spread="0" box_shadow_color="" box_shadow_style="" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="" background_type="single" gradient_start_color="" gradient_end_color="" gradient_start_position="0" gradient_end_position="100" gradient_type="linear" radial_direction="center" linear_angle="180" background_color="" background_image="" background_image_id="" background_position="left top" background_repeat="no-repeat" background_blend_mode="none" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" filter_type="regular" filter_hue="0" filter_saturation="100" filter_brightness="100" filter_contrast="100" filter_invert="0" filter_sepia="0" filter_opacity="100" filter_blur="0" filter_hue_hover="0" filter_saturation_hover="100" filter_brightness_hover="100" filter_contrast_hover="100" filter_invert_hover="0" filter_sepia_hover="0" filter_opacity_hover="100" filter_blur_hover="0" last="no"][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Being evicted is stressful both when it happens and in the long term, as you are looking for a new apartment. It can even make buying a home more difficult. The best way to deal with eviction is to avoid it altogether but sometimes this just isn’t possible. You may not have the money to pay your rent or be able to remedy a circumstance that violates your lease. However, there are ways you may be able to stop the process once it has begun.[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]The most effective way to stop the eviction process is to pay your back rent or fix the lease violation. Paying back rent may be difficult to do if you didn’t have the money to pay rent in the first place. In these cases, you may have to borrow money. This can be beneficial because you get to keep your residence and are able to pay back money over time, in smaller chunks, whether you take out a loan or borrow from family or friends.[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]If paying back rent or fixing the circumstance isn’t possible, your landlord may proceed with the eviction process. However, there is a very specific process they must follow to evict you and if it not followed, you may be able to keep your apartment. Forcing you out without going through the required process or evicting you out of retaliation can definitely have the eviction dismissed. Also, if the unit or building upkeep was subpar or requested repairs were not completed, it can be grounds for a terminated eviction.[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]The smartest move you can make once you’re served an eviction notice is to research research the eviction laws in your state. It’s important to know what your landlord can and can’t do during the process. As shown above, avoiding an eviction may be as easy as reporting a missed or ignored step.[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]However, sometimes an eviction just can’t be avoided. If you end up evicted and need to figure out how to find housing with it on your record, check out our blog How to Find Housing With an Eviction on Your Record.[/fusion_text][fusion_separator style_type="none" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="" top_margin="10px" bottom_margin="10px" border_size="" icon="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]By: Alecia Stanton[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

Title: Three Government Programs That Could Help You Get Into An Apartment
Content:
[fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" hundred_percent_height="no" hundred_percent_height_scroll="no" hundred_percent_height_center_content="yes" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" status="published" publish_date="" class="" id="" border_size="" border_color="" border_style="solid" margin_top="" margin_bottom="" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" gradient_start_color="" gradient_end_color="" gradient_start_position="0" gradient_end_position="100" gradient_type="linear" radial_direction="center" linear_angle="180" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="center center" background_repeat="no-repeat" fade="no" background_parallax="none" enable_mobile="no" parallax_speed="0.3" background_blend_mode="none" video_mp4="" video_webm="" video_ogv="" video_url="" video_aspect_ratio="16:9" video_loop="yes" video_mute="yes" video_preview_image="" filter_hue="0" filter_saturation="100" filter_brightness="100" filter_contrast="100" filter_invert="0" filter_sepia="0" filter_opacity="100" filter_blur="0" filter_hue_hover="0" filter_saturation_hover="100" filter_brightness_hover="100" filter_contrast_hover="100" filter_invert_hover="0" filter_sepia_hover="0" filter_opacity_hover="100" filter_blur_hover="0"][fusion_builder_row][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" spacing="" center_content="no" link="" target="_self" min_height="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" hover_type="none" border_size="0" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" border_radius="" box_shadow="no" dimension_box_shadow="" box_shadow_blur="0" box_shadow_spread="0" box_shadow_color="" box_shadow_style="" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="" background_type="single" gradient_start_color="" gradient_end_color="" gradient_start_position="0" gradient_end_position="100" gradient_type="linear" radial_direction="center" linear_angle="180" background_color="" background_image="" background_image_id="" background_position="left top" background_repeat="no-repeat" background_blend_mode="none" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" filter_type="regular" filter_hue="0" filter_saturation="100" filter_brightness="100" filter_contrast="100" filter_invert="0" filter_sepia="0" filter_opacity="100" filter_blur="0" filter_hue_hover="0" filter_saturation_hover="100" filter_brightness_hover="100" filter_contrast_hover="100" filter_invert_hover="0" filter_sepia_hover="0" filter_opacity_hover="100" filter_blur_hover="0" last="no"][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]

When you have less than stellar credit, a low income, or an eviction on your record renting an apartment can prove to be a struggle. There are charities and nonprofits that may be able to help but they often have limited funds or have run out altogether. But there’s another place to turn for help: the government.

[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]The U.S government runs housing programs through the  U.S Department of Housing & Urban Development, or HUD. This department provides assistance for both buyers and renters. They also provide information on any housing related questions you may have.[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]

In HUD’s first program, they enable rental properties to offer low income tenants a reduced rent amount. They do this by providing incentives to the owners of these properties. Potential tenants that would like to receive this assistance apply through the rental properties management office. You can find privately owned subsidized housing near you using HUD's Low Rent Apartment Search.

[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]

Public housing program run by HUD, managed by regional Public Housing Authorities (or PHA’s). Public housing is affordable apartment properties for low income families as well as elderly and disabled individuals. Unlike privately owned subsidized housing, public housing is owned and operated by the local PHA. To find out about eligibility and availability, contact your local PHA, which you can find on HUD’s PHA Contact Information page.

[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Housing Choice Vouchers, HUD’s third housing program, also takes applications through regional PHA’s. Better known as Section 8, these vouchers allows low income families choose their own apartment and the PHA pays all or a part of their rent. You can also find out about eligibility and availability through your local PHA. Unfortunately, there tends to be fairly long waitlists for this type of assistance so this option will require patience and flexibility,[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Don’t be afraid to use this assistance if you are having a hard time getting into an apartment. Remember to apply as soon as possible. After applying, continue to check out additional programs so that you’ll have a backup plan or additional assistance.[/fusion_text][fusion_separator style_type="none" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="" top_margin="10px" bottom_margin="10px" border_size="" icon="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]By: Alecia Stanton[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

Title: How to Find Free Bedroom Furniture
Content:
[fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" hundred_percent_height="no" hundred_percent_height_scroll="no" hundred_percent_height_center_content="yes" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" status="published" publish_date="" class="" id="" border_size="" border_color="" border_style="solid" margin_top="" margin_bottom="" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" gradient_start_color="" gradient_end_color="" gradient_start_position="0" gradient_end_position="100" gradient_type="linear" radial_direction="center" linear_angle="180" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="center center" background_repeat="no-repeat" fade="no" background_parallax="none" enable_mobile="no" parallax_speed="0.3" background_blend_mode="none" video_mp4="" video_webm="" video_ogv="" video_url="" video_aspect_ratio="16:9" video_loop="yes" video_mute="yes" video_preview_image="" filter_hue="0" filter_saturation="100" filter_brightness="100" filter_contrast="100" filter_invert="0" filter_sepia="0" filter_opacity="100" filter_blur="0" filter_hue_hover="0" filter_saturation_hover="100" filter_brightness_hover="100" filter_contrast_hover="100" filter_invert_hover="0" filter_sepia_hover="0" filter_opacity_hover="100" filter_blur_hover="0"][fusion_builder_row][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" spacing="" center_content="no" link="" target="_self" min_height="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" hover_type="none" border_size="0" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" border_radius="" box_shadow="no" dimension_box_shadow="" box_shadow_blur="0" box_shadow_spread="0" box_shadow_color="" box_shadow_style="" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="" background_type="single" gradient_start_color="" gradient_end_color="" gradient_start_position="0" gradient_end_position="100" gradient_type="linear" radial_direction="center" linear_angle="180" background_color="" background_image="" background_image_id="" background_position="left top" background_repeat="no-repeat" background_blend_mode="none" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" filter_type="regular" filter_hue="0" filter_saturation="100" filter_brightness="100" filter_contrast="100" filter_invert="0" filter_sepia="0" filter_opacity="100" filter_blur="0" filter_hue_hover="0" filter_saturation_hover="100" filter_brightness_hover="100" filter_contrast_hover="100" filter_invert_hover="0" filter_sepia_hover="0" filter_opacity_hover="100" filter_blur_hover="0" last="no"][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Bedroom furniture is almost always expensive. One piece can sometimes cost a full check. Thankfully, there is free furniture available, if you know where to look. Of course, asking friends and family is always a great place to start. However, if that doesn’t yield results, try some of these:[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Furniture Banks[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Furniture banks offer free and low cost (gently used) furniture to those in need. Most big cities have locally run furniture banks and The Furniture Bank Association of North America has a listing of furniture banks across the country. You can find them at FurnitureBanks.org.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Craigslist[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]While Craigslist is notorious for buying and selling things cheaply, you can also sometimes find things for free. Just search for bedroom furniture and sort the results from lowest to highest price. Also, look for “Everything Must Go” sales, as they are more desperate to get rid of their pieces.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Freecyle[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]This website was created specifically for finding and giving away free items. Simply visit Freecyle.org and search enter your city and state or zip code to find your areas freecyle page. You can look for people giving away furniture, laptops, clothes and more.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Salvation Army Free Furniture Voucher[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]The Salvation Army provides furniture vouchers to those in need. Visit your nearest Salvation Army to ask them for one. If you don’t know where the closest Salvation Army is, you can check their website (http://www.salvationarmyusa.org).[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Yard Sales[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Check out yard sales at the end of the day to get deals on the furniture they have left over. If they really need to get rid of it, they’ll work with you. For a better chance, it may be smart to bring a bit of money.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Curbside Furniture[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]We’ve all seen the furniture on the curb with “Take Me” signs. Take advantage of these invitations when you see them. Just make sure to check that it doesn’t have any serious problems like moisture or bugs. If you go this route, night stands and drawers would be a better bet than mattresses.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Facebook Groups[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Facebook Swap & Sell groups have recently become popular. At least one of your facebook friends is probably a member of your local Swap & Sell group so finding one shouldn’t be hard. Often, you can find people giving away bedroom furniture and asking for nothing in return. Regardless of where you find free bedroom furniture, be sure that it is sturdy enough for use and free of critters. Cleaning all pieces of bedroom furniture before use is also a good idea.[/fusion_text][fusion_separator style_type="none" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="" top_margin="10px" bottom_margin="10px" border_size="" icon="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]

By: Alecia Stanton
*Originally posted May 3rd, 2016

[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" sticky_display="normal,sticky" class="" id="" font_size="" fusion_font_family_text_font="" fusion_font_variant_text_font="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" text_color="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""][the_ad_group id="128"] Unfortunately, homeless shelters have limited space and are often at capacity. One solution to this problem is hotel/ motel vouchers. This allows organizations to house the homeless when they do not personally have the resources to do so. These are the best five places to find them:[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="10px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="0px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color="" margin_top_small="" margin_bottom_small="0px"]Homeless Shelters[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" content_alignment_medium="" content_alignment_small="" content_alignment="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" sticky_display="normal,sticky" class="" id="" font_size="" fusion_font_family_text_font="" fusion_font_variant_text_font="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" text_color="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Because their mission is to provide shelter to the homeless, they often provide hotel vouchers when they do not have enough space. Visit the nearest shelter and ask if they can provide you with one or point you in the direction of someone that can. [the_ad id="1910"][/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="10px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="0px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color="" margin_top_small="" margin_bottom_small="0px"]The Salvation Army[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Known for providing relief to those in all types of hardships, The Salvation Army has a considerable list of services for the homeless. Some locations have shelters and many give hotel vouchers. Find your local Salvation Army and ask if they have any available.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="10px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="0px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color="" margin_top_small="" margin_bottom_small="0px"]Regional Homeless Assistance Programs[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" content_alignment_medium="" content_alignment_small="" content_alignment="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" sticky_display="normal,sticky" class="" id="" font_size="" fusion_font_family_text_font="" fusion_font_variant_text_font="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" text_color="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Most counties and/or regions have homeless assistance programs. You can usually find them by visiting your nearest human services offices. They can typically provide you with a hotel voucher or some sort of emergency housing assistance. [the_ad_group id="129"][/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="10px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="0px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color="" margin_top_small="" margin_bottom_small="0px"] Catholic Charities [/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" content_alignment_medium="" content_alignment_small="" content_alignment="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" sticky_display="normal,sticky" class="" id="" font_size="" fusion_font_family_text_font="" fusion_font_variant_text_font="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" text_color="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]This charity is also known for providing hardship relief. They don’t have shelters but most locations offer hotel vouchers to those in need. You can search for a Catholic Charities near you for information on how to contact them.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="10px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="0px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color="" margin_top_small="" margin_bottom_small="0px"] 2-1-1 [/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" content_alignment_medium="" content_alignment_small="" content_alignment="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" sticky_display="normal,sticky" class="" id="" font_size="" fusion_font_family_text_font="" fusion_font_variant_text_font="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" text_color="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]While they can’t provide you with a hotel voucher, they can guide you to someone who can. This service leads people in need to resources in their area. You can visit their website or call them at 2-1-1. If you can’t get into a shelter, know that you have other options. Getting to the help you need may be difficult but you can’t give up. You will find help! [the_ad id='1911'][/fusion_text][fusion_separator style_type="none" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="" top_margin="10px" bottom_margin="10px" border_size="" icon="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="0px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="0px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color="" margin_top_small="" margin_bottom_small="0px"]By: Alecia Stanton[/fusion_title][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]
Excerpt: Emergency housing is one of your top priorities if you have become homeless.

Title: Top 4 Places To Find Homes For Rent

rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]If you’re tired of renting apartments but not quite ready to buy your own house, rental homes are a great option. It offers the best of both worlds, with a much less complicated process but the space and comfort of a home. However, despite it’s popularity, they can sometimes be difficult to find. As usual, the internet is a great resource for your search if you know where to look. Among all of the websites offering help, these are the most useful and easiest to use:[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="10px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="0px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Zillow[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Zillow is one of the more well-known house hunting websites, and for good reason. You can search for homes to buy as well as apartments and rental homes. Their listing of homes for rent is one of the largest you will find and you can search by specifications such as price and number of bedrooms.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="10px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="0px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Trulia[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Another popular search tool, Trulia offers the same features as Zillow but with a more user-friendly layout. They also have a great rental fraud FAQ to help you avoid home renting pitfalls. It’s also ideal if you are concerned about what school district homes are located in or your commute time.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="10px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="0px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]ShowMeTheRent[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]This website may less prominent but lists rental properties exclusively. It also has a super layout, making the search process much smoother. If you have questions or just want more information about renting, you can check out their blog.The Renters Survival Guide section could be especially helpful. Looking for an apartment to rent is much less stressful when you know where to turn. Having some guidance means you can enjoy the experience and be more excited about the possibilities. Happy hunting![/fusion_text][fusion_separator style_type="none" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="" top_margin="10px" bottom_margin="10px" border_size="" icon="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="0px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="0px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]By: Alecia Stanton[/fusion_title][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

Title: top-5-places-to-find-a-room-for-rent

radial_direction="center" linear_angle="180" background_color="" background_image="" background_image_id="" background_position="left top" background_repeat="no-repeat" background_blend_mode="none" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" filter_type="regular" filter_hue="0" filter_saturation="100" filter_brightness="100" filter_contrast="100" filter_invert="0" filter_sepia="0" filter_opacity="100" filter_blur="0" filter_hue_hover="0" filter_saturation_hover="100" filter_brightness_hover="100" filter_contrast_hover="100" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Renting a room has become an increasingly popular option as apartments become less and less affordable. It’s also become more common for homeowners to rent rooms out to bring in extra money. This popularity also makes easier than ever to find rooms to rent. These are the five most popular ways. Unfortunately, some camps are expensive. Since they provide food, entertainment, and occasionally, a place to sleep, it’s only natural that a lot of camps would be out of your price range. Don’t give up yet, though - there are plenty of options for affordable summer camp. Here’s where you should start looking:[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Friends and Family[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]The best way to start your search is by asking your friends and family if they are renting out a room or know someone that is. Not only could this yield results quickly but the chances that you’ll be living with someone you know is much higher.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Roommate Finder Websites[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]There is a growing number of websites dedicated to helping people find roommates and rooms for rent. Some of the best known ones are Roommates.com and Easyroommate.com. These websites will allow you to search by location and rent price so you won’t waste your time searching for rooms you don’t need to see.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Craigslist[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]As most know, Craigslist is a great place to find almost anything, including a room. However, take extra precaution when moving in with someone on Craigslist. Check out the home and have agreement written out and signed by both parties before you hand over any money. They may want to run a background check on you, and it won’t hurt to run one on them as well.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Trulia[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Trulia is a well-known website for finding apartments and homes but many don’t know that they also list rooms for rent. What makes Trulia special is that you can search for pet-friendly rooms so that you know ahead of time that it will be okay to bring your pet.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Facebook[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Facebook offers an extended network to search through when looking for a room to rent. Not only do you have friends and family available but all of their friends and family as well! This also makes it easier to verify that the person you are renting a room from is safe. Wherever you look, make sure that anyone you are considering renting a room from are safe to live with and not running a scam. If you know someone who knows them or has rented a room from them, ask about their experience. Also, try to be the best renter you can while occupying a room so that you can use them as a reference when you move on.[/fusion_text][fusion_separator style_type="none" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="" top_margin="10px" bottom_margin="10px" border_size="" icon="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Alecia Stanton[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

Title: What to Know About Habitat for Humanity

rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Habitat for Humanity is a well known non-profit organization that has helped millions of low income families get into homes. It was founded in the 70’s and has expanded to multiple countries. But if you’re looking to get a Habitat for Humanity home, this information probably isn’t too important to you. Here is what you really want to know:[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]
  • The homes aren’t free. The homeowners, or partners as HFH calls them, are given an affordable mortgage with 0% interest. They are also required to give “sweat equity hours”, which is time helping to build their home or someone else’s.
  • Habitat for Humanity doesn’t just build new homes. They also renovate existing buildings and provide disaster response services.
  • Applicants are chosen based on their need for housing, ability to pay the mortgage, and willingness to partner. 
  • You can only apply at your local Habitat for Humanity office, which you can find here.
[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]

If you think that you may qualify for a Habitat for Humanity home, apply as soon as possible. Spaces tend to fill up quickly and applicants are chosen on a first come, first serve basis.

[/fusion_text][fusion_separator style_type="none" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="" top_margin="10px" bottom_margin="10px" border_size="" icon="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]By: Alecia Stanton[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

Title: Moving On a Budget
Content: [fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" hundred_percent_height="no" hundred_percent_height_scroll="no" hundred_percent_height_center_content="yes" equal_height_columns="no" box_shadow="no" dimension_box_shadow="" box_shadow_blur="0" box_shadow_spread="0" box_shadow_color="" box_shadow_style="" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" filter_invert="0" filter_sepia="0" filter_opacity="100" filter_blur="0" filter_hue_hover="0" filter_saturation_hover="100" filter_brightness_hover="100" filter_contrast_hover="100" filter_invert_hover="0" filter_sepia_hover="0" filter_opacity_hover="100" filter_blur_hover="0" last="no"][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Moving doesn’t have to break your bank. A bit of planning and assistance goes a long way. Whether moving across town or across the country, you can slash costs by finding cheap alternatives and tying up loose ends early. Try these easy tricks to save money on your move:[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Get Free Boxes[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Ask friends, family, and coworkers if they have any boxes they can spare. Post on Facebook to reach as many people as you can at once. Liquor stores typically have sturdy boxes they are willing to give away if you ask. Grocery stores also usually have discarded boxes in the back.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Shut Off Early[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Turn off non-essential utilities like cable and telephone early if the billing cycle doesn’t match up to your moving date. This prevents you from having to pay for time that you are not using them.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Pack Lightly[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Take only what you need and sell or donate the rest. You will have less stuff to transport, which will save you money whether you are using a moving service or doing it on your own. If you sell what you aren’t taking, you even make some extra cash.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="5px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="5px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Borrow a Truck[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]If you do not own a truck, make an effort to borrow before going to rent one. As with boxes, ask friends, family, and coworkers if they have a truck they are willing to lend you. They may also offer to assist you with your move and drive the truck. These tips are simple yet effective. Not only do you get to minimize your moving cost, but have less clutter in your new home.[/fusion_text][fusion_separator style_type="none" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="" top_margin="10px" bottom_margin="10px" border_size="" icon="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]By: Alecia Stanton[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

Title: Avoid Scams With The FTC Scam Alert
Content:
[fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" hundred_percent_height="no" hundred_percent_height_scroll="no" hundred_percent_height_center_content="yes" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" filter_invert="0" filter_sepia="0" filter_opacity="100" filter_blur="0" filter_hue_hover="0" filter_saturation_hover="100" filter_brightness_hover="100" filter_contrast_hover="100" filter_invert_hover="0" filter_sepia_hover="0" filter_opacity_hover="100" filter_blur_hover="0" last="no"][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]No one wants to think about it, but everyone who uses the internet or phone is at risk of being scammed. People from all backgrounds can be tricked into giving money or personal information to criminals, and if you do, it can be nearly impossible to track them down. You can help protect yourself by staying informed, and one of the best ways to do that is by following the Federal Trade Commission, a government agency for consumer protection. They keep an up-to-date list of scams, and you can even sign up for email updates. Click below for more information.[/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="10px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="0px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]FTC Scam Alert[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]

In addition, keep these simple tips in mind:

  • If something sounds too good to be true, it probably is
  • If someone emails you from a professional company but the message has a lot of spelling mistakes, it’s probably not legitimate
  • Don’t give your private information to an untrusted person or company
  • Don’t click on links from email addresses you don’t recognize
  • Be suspicious of someone asking you to send money through Western Union or another money transfer service
[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]As a reminder, AHR’s services are free and we will not reach out to you to ask for money under any circumstances. If someone claiming to be from AHR has contacted you about money, please let us know by emailing info@americanhoperesources.com.[/fusion_text][fusion_separator style_type="none" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="" top_margin="10px" bottom_margin="10px" border_size="" icon="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="5" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="0px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="0px" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]By Luke Smith[/fusion_title][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

Ten Father's Day Restaurant Deals
Content:

rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Father’s Day is almost here - do you know how you’re going to celebrate? If you’re starting to panic, don’t worry - restaurants across the country are offering free meals to dads. Here are ten popular options:[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]

Firehouse Subs - Use this coupon to receive a free medium sub with the purchase of a medium or large sub, fries, and drink.

[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Bertucci’s - Visit their Father’s Day page, upload a picture of your dad and say why he inspires you and you’ll receive a coupon for a free small pizza with the purchase of another entree.[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]

PDQ - Earn a free combo meal with the purchase of another meal, including kids meals.

[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Beef O’Brady’s - Dads get a free meal of up to $10 with the purchase of another $10 meal.[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Spaghetti Warehouse - Dine in and enjoy a free 15-Layer Lasagna or Original Recipe Spaghetti entree.[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Texas Steakhouse & Saloon - Eat at Texas Steakhouse & Saloon on Father’s Day and you’ll receive a certificate for a free entree, eligible to be used on a future visit.[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Shoney’s - Shoney’s is offering a Father’s Day Food Bar, featuring garlic shrimp, fried chicken, peach cobbler, and more. Dads will also receive a free slice of pie.[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]

First Watch - Dad’s receive a free small bag of coffee with the purchase of a meal.

[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Medieval Times - Buy one adult ticket using the code DAD17 and get a free ticket.[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]TCBY - Dads get a free (unspecified) treat on Father’s Day.[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]As a reminder, these offers are not affiliated with AHR and are available at participating locations only. Happy Father’s Day![/fusion_text][fusion_separator style_type="none" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="" top_margin="10px" bottom_margin="10px" border_size="" icon="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

Title: 10 Best Things To Buy In January
Content:

animation_offset=""]You probably don’t want to spend another cent after the holidays are over. But there are a few things that you deals you can catch in January that are even better than Black Friday and Christmas deals! Some of these deals can prevent you from paying a lot more money for the same items down the line. Here are the best ones to check out:[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Christmas Decorations. Once the holiday season has ended, stores are trying to clear out the decorations they haven’t sold. This means big savings for you.[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Valentine’s Day Gifts. Not only will you have a better selection, but much better prices when you buy Valentine’s Day gifts early. Check jewelry stores and flower delivery services to see what deals they are offering.[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]

Bedding & Towels. January home good sales are known as white sales. Department and big box stores lower the prices during the month, allowing you to stock up on linens, bedding, and towels for the upcoming year, for a fraction of the cost.

[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Gym Memberships. Gyms and fitness centers cash in on the most popular new year’s resolution, to lose weight/get fit, by lowering membership costs and waiving enrollments fee’s. Because of this, January is the best time to get your gym membership.[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]

Health & Fitness Gear. Like gym memberships, most people flock to exercise clothes, fitness equipment, and wearables like Fitbits at the beginning of the year. Retailers have also taken note and slash prices to cash in on the new year’s resolution frenzy.

[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Dress Clothes. In January, many stores start trying to clear out space for spring styles. That means you can get fall and winter dress clothes for much lower prices.[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Winter Produce. Buying seasonal produce is a more well-known way to save. Here’s a refresher in case you’ve forgotten which are best in winter:[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]

Fruits:

  • Apples
  • Grapefruit
  • Clementines
  • Kiwi
  • Lemons
  • Oranges
  • Passion fruit
  • Pears
  • Tangerines
[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]

Vegetables

  • Brussel Sprouts
  • Cauliflower
  • Carrots
  • Celery
  • Kale
  • Parsnips
  • Spinach
  • Turnips
[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Furniture. Stores usually release new furnitures designs in February, so clear out old styles in January. An added bonus of catching this deal is that you get to start the new year with some new furniture![/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]Tax Software. Forethought can really pay off when it comes to tax season. If you plan on filing your taxes on your own, buy the software early for a much better price.[/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]You most likely don’t need all of these items, but buying the ones you do need for less than you would have to pay down the line is a smart move. Plus, maybe January is a good month to treat yourself![/fusion_text][fusion_separator style_type="none" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="" top_margin="10px" bottom_margin="10px" border_size="" icon="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

Title: New Tax Laws For The 2016 Tax Year
New Tax Laws For The 2016 Tax Year
Content:
[fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" hundred_percent_height="no" hundred_percent_height_scroll="no" hundred_percent_height_center_content="yes" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor=""
